etymologies: mid 18th century: modern Latin, from Greek, feminine of azaleos ‘dry’, because the shrub flourishes in dry soil

definitions: a deciduous flowering shrub of the heath family with clusters of brightly colored, sometimes fragrant flowers. Technically classified as rhododendrons, azaleas are characteristically smaller than most other rhododendrons.

notes.text: Genus Rhododendron, family Ericaceae: many cultivars

shortDefinitions: deciduous flowering shrub with clusters of brightly coloured
